pros: Good work environment. Fair pay and great benefits
cons: Lot of work in family med can be stressful

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Lewiston, ID
pros: Good pay Good pto Good benefits
cons: Management is toxic. None of the management have attended more than highschool so if that tells you anything. It’s a good boys club - who knows who and no one who actually knows their job is going to get promoted or good raises. They don’t fire people unless they have a grudge against them. But they will keep the employees who are getting hippa violation after hippa violation. They keep those employees AND give them raises and promotions. They do this because management doesn’t want to handle the issues themselves so they keep passing the problem to other departments. CHAS is based off grants etc tax payer money and other avenues. And I can tell you from experience that your money is being wasted. Half the time they create roles that don’t do anything to give their friends a promotion and job. So most the time these people are standing around talking, online shopping, or just causing problems. The people are sneaky and conniving. It’s like highschool all over again - but with people only having graduated from highschool one should not be surprised of that. The managers and supervisors and admin are lazy. From the lowest man on the totem pole. The people on the floor are working the hardest and getting the least compensation. The values of the company and the mission are amazing it’s why I wanted to be an employee there. However they don’t follow any of it. I can’t tell you any admin or upper management in any clinic who truly follows the values.

review_title: There's a lot of hope and drive in this company, but unfortunately management lack compassion.
pros: Benefits are great and the work we do for our community is wonderful.
cons: The organization grew very quickly, leaving support staff scrambling to meet ever-increasing needs. This had eliminated vital vetting processes for new managers and unfortunately, their treatment of employees is not in line with the culture CHAS purports to have. Raises are fixed at 3% per year except very rare circumstances so new hires will make more than long-term employees.

review_title: Good pay, benefits, and work enviroment
job_title: Certified Medical Assitant in Spokane, WA
pros: Loved working here! Great management, pay, and benefits
cons: Work flow can be a lot sometimes

pros: very friendly people that work with you
cons: on a sas system, so most work is done through other companies

pros: - Enthusiastic and supportive management -Free coffee -enjoyable work environment
cons: - Slow moving in the company - Takes a while to get a project off the ground in Healthcare

pros: Very flexible with schedules that work well with family.
cons: Admin makes all the decisions. There seems to be very little say into workflows from the employees who are doing them.

job_title: Community Health Worker in Spokane, WA
pros: pretty good benefits and time off
cons: Clinic Culture can be toxic. Lots of contempt between coworkers.

pros: Stay for the benefits and the salary increase every year, plus lots of other fun employee opportunities.
cons: There's not a whole lot of room for growth, especially in the administrative departments.

review_title: CHAS, a non-profit company, that treats patients and staff well
pros: decent hourly pay; yearly bonus + staff celebration; bi-annual stipend for uniforms; able to accrue PTO quickly; good benefits
cons: occasional weekend shifts, occasional floating to other clinics when short staffed or different departments

pros: The benefits are great. The PTO is generous. You don't have to work nights. There is an occasional Saturday every couple months that is scheduled to work. You have to work one holiday a year.
cons: There are too many people in administration writing new policies and procedures, who are one step removed from the actual work.

review_title: I kind of like it here
job_title: Systems Engineer I in Spokane, WA
pros:
very friending group to work with.
Good Benefits, 
Competitive Wages
cons:
Too many people in management roles to effectively get decisions made.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Spokane, WA
pros: Good salaries, bonuses and terrific benefits including HSA, free health insurance for employee if you participate in the wellness program, several weeks of vacation right away. Snacks delivered frequently to clinics. Computer systems work well, technology/EMR works. Typical schedule is four 10-hour days, most people like this. Typically cheerful employees. Pharmacies on site at most clinics, pharmacists are wonderful and helpful.
cons: Grueling schedule, can be 20 patients a day, you run between patients and eat lunch at your desk. Poor communication with anyone above the direct clinic you work in, and sometimes poor with clinic administrators as well. Primarily underserved population, can have many complicated hospital discharges and homeless/drug addicted/mentally ill patients. Colleagues willing to lend support but often too busy to help much. People can be fired with little explanation. Inbox workload can be crushing. Very "woke" environment, if you are conservative you had better keep your mouth shut.

pros: Love everything about the company
cons: No cons at the moment

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Spokane, WA
pros: The pay is well above average. Bonuses are generous. Benefits are great. Theres even a yearly $5000 childcare fund for employees. By far the best company I've ever worked for. They really care about their employees and patients. Lots of opportunities for advancement, regardless of your position.
cons: As with anywhere in the healthcare field, especially with covid right now, there are staffing shortages and we are stretched thin.

job_title: Quality Improvement Coach in Spokane, WA
pros: Health insurance, PTO, direct management is great
cons: Pay. Severely underpaid making only $1.92 more than entry level front office staff

job_title: Service Desk Technician in Spokane, WA
pros: Great company with decent pay. Good environment and great coworkers.
cons: Environment can change quickly. At times, scheduling needs for employees can be overlook for good of company or more senior employees. Training/shadowing opportunities are not provided as promised, limiting advancement opportunities.

job_title: Behavrioral Health Tech in Spokane, WA
pros: Good environment and good supervisors
cons: Slower pace of patients and phone calls.

job_title: Business Applications Support Analyst in Spokane, WA
pros: The organization has wonderful employees and provides internal growth and promotions.
cons: The org is extremely disorganized. There is no org-wide change management or structured communication, causing constant chaos and confusion. The org does not have the stability it needs for long-term sustainability. It's growing faster than the staff can manage, causing employees to get burnt out quickly and looking for an employer who can offer structure and sustainability. Executive leadership is extremely disconnected with the day-to-day operations of the administration office, what it takes to keep the wheels turning, as well as staffing needs. Employees now have an extremely lack of trust in executive leadership. They have a vision and require employees to help get them there, however they don't offer the support, wage, or resources needed to get there.

review_title: Good as everyone says it is
pros: Generous PTO, incredible culture, impactful work
cons: Hard to say no to additional work and projects

review_title: I plan to work at CHAS for the whole of my career
pros: Great benefits, competitive pay reviewed regularly, growth opportunities, company is invested in growing its people and supporting staff. Covid response was spectacular. Company puts its money where its mouth is in all aspects.
cons: CHAS tends to put the cart before the horse when it comes to problem solving. I think this is why people complain about management and communication. It feels like changes come without warning. But in health care, you have to be ready to adapt and overcome.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Spokane, WA
pros: There is a great work atmosphere.
cons: Things change quickly, but this never bothered me

job_title: Quality Improvement Coach in Spokane, WA
pros: Loved CHAS. I miss the people there.
cons: At times I felt there was a disconnect between admin and the clinics. Majority of this came from lack of clear communication from both ends. Was improving as I left.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Spokane, WA
pros: Chas Health is a very supportive company with great benefits. They really take care of their employees and create a healthy working environment.
cons: As any customer service job, it can get very exhausting. You just need to make sure that you are giving your all each day and remember to not let rude guests ruin your day.

job_title: Patient Experience Specialist in Spokane, WA
pros: Fast paced call center environment. Coworkers were great. Management supportive. Great compensation.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Centralized Service Specialist in Spokane, WA
pros: The mission and co-workers are good
cons: Business practices are 15 years out of date. Each clinic operates as its own little island with not central direction. Processes are needlessly complicated leading to errors and poor customer service. They treat employees like children a lot of times. Communication from the top is non-existent. They use software that was out of date ten years ago. There is no accountability, yet immense pressure.

pros: Feels like you're helping people, supportive supervisors, friendly coworker culture, flexible hours
cons: Strict regulations and entitled patients conflict OFTEN, provider and provider assistant staff don't communicate well with front office

pros: Pay is great and so are most of the coworkers
cons: Understaffed, do more with less attitude, favoritism from people that have been with the company a long time and are burnt out

pros: good pay and good people
cons: no room for growth or promotion

pros: benefits are great for this company

review_title: Amazing culture focused on employees and patients

cons: Administration does not listen to provider feedback on making clinical decisions that impact our schedules and patient care. Top heavy in administration staff who are completely out of touch with clinical staff. Great mission but poor execution in the mission.

pros: Pay and benefits free food

pros: Fun atmosphere and great people
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

job_title: Patient Services Coordinator in Spokane, WA
pros: Great pay, awesome benefits including PTO, most employees genuinely cared about the mission and helping others.
cons: Lack of consistency for disciplinary actions.  Administration is out of touch with what actually happens at each of the clinics.  There used to be a great possibility for advancement at CHAS but now it's more about who you know on the hiring team and if you've brown nosed enough to them.

pros: This is a rapidly growing company, offers a variety of careers and growth opportunities. Serving the underserved population, with medical, dental, pharmacy and behavioral health services regardless of their ability to pay. Most employees work very hard and the company has great benefits. I have worked here for over 6 years and plan on staying here for the rest of my career.
cons: There can be a high turn over rate for medical staff and a disconnect between clinics and administration.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Spokane, WA
pros: Company is dedicated to their employees and paid well for the Spokane area. They offer an excellent PTO package. The poor reviews I have read usually go hand in hand with a disgruntled employee not happy because of their own personal issues. CHAS is an outstanding company with a lot of longevity employees and committed to to our patients in the Clinic settings and Administration . I recommend CHAS to anyone, love my job.
cons: There is none! Great leadership that truly cares about you and the their teams. Beautiful new building and warm feeling when present and the opportunity To work remote.

review_title: DON'T WORK HERE-THEY ASK EMPLOYEES TO WRITE GOOD REVIEWS ONLY
pros: not one pro to working at this place.
cons: Don't pay people the same for the same job.  Don't listen to providers input.  Too much middle management because they create unneeded jobs for all of their friends.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Spokane, WA
pros: Flexible scheduling, excellent benefits, great pay, room to climb the ladder, providers and workers that are dedicated to CHAS mission and providing great patient care. There is a sense of community here.
cons: It's community health, all the challenges that come with that.

job_title: Physician, Family Medicine in Spokane, WA
pros: Mission statement. Pharmacy staff is the best.
cons: Extremely poor administration with little support or respect for their physicians. Only one doc in administration and he has very little authority to change anything. Everyone else in admin has minimal medical background. Middle management has way too much authority and absolutely no experience. Doctors are generally not lead providers. Scheduling is terrible and receptionists are not trained and do not know what they're doing. Patients are not getting the care they deserve because of scheduling demands.

pros: CHAS has great schedules and decent pay
cons: Micromanaged, will follow you and video out of work activities and submit to HR, you will see a very high turn over rate and I do not believe it is employees. It has been displayed that it is a admin and HR issue.

review_title: Making a difference in the lives of many everyday
pros:
This is a rapidly growing company, offers a variety of careers and growth opportunities. Serving the underserved population, with medical, dental, pharmacy and behavioral health services regardless of their ability to pay.

They offer great benefits and competitive compensation and flexible work schedules.

Co-workers are very passionate about the mission and give their best everyday.
cons: There needs to be more training.

pros: I love that we are able to help the communities we serve and make a difference in patient  health by doing what we can on our side to make sure patients can be seen and get all of their medications every month.  Lost count on how many times our patients are thankful to have us here.
cons: No cons, company always strives to improve any areas  that need improvement. They complete employee reviews annually and listen.

pros: Great benefits/ compensation. Abilities to work in many fields such as urgent care, OB/GYN, family practice, etc.
cons: Depending on what clinic you are at, management can be tricky. Some bosses like you to speak up and others want you to stay quiet and not share any suggestions or thoughts. Again, depending on the clinic, there can also be a lot of drama and cliques. Employees can be pretty shady but if you’re ok with that, this is the place for you.

review_title: CHAS has a great mission, dedicated employees, but is administratively a disaster.
pros:
-Strong mission.
-Loyal patients that appreciate the care they receive.
-Decent pay.
cons:
-Underqualified managment and administrative personnel with people that literally have no clue what they are doing.
-A Healthcare Organization that is administrative top heavy with numerous laywers as administrators who are great at talking the talk but not walking the walk.
-Federally funded with what seems like little motivation to increase efficiency.
-Many unhappy Physicians and Mid-Levels ( NP's & PA's ).
-Turnover is extremely high.

pros:
The Mission
Flexible scheduling
Great benefits
Opportunity for growth
cons: Nothing comes to mind. This company is flexible and dedicated to changing with the times and being a great place to work, while serving the community.
